Topic.Title: Tricked by your hero

Message.Msg: Rapid blinking and stammering by Obama signals lying. Looking to the top right suggests the creation of images. This is a strong indication that he is lying to you. 10 ways to catch a liar. When you want to know if someone is lying, look for inconsistencies in what they are saying. Obama said the raid in Benghazi was due to a Youtube video protest. We know it was not. Oh what a tangled web we weave, when first we practice to deceive! Obama went to great lengths to make a speech at the U.N. condemning the YouTube video and to catch the perpetrator, put him all over TV. It looked like the movie Argo. I've never seen law enforcement move that quickly in my life. Way too much lib media coverage to cover up the truth. Most people can't fake smile. The timing will be wrong, it will be held too long or inappropriate. That was Biden smiling like a clown during the debate. Remember how Obama cracked a big smile like a Cheshire cat when Candy Crowley (the moderator) fell all over herself interrupting Romney to read a transcript of Obama's remarks where near the end of his speech he made a non-specific reference to protecting America from terror. Topic.Title: I ADMIT, OBAMA should be IMPEACHED Because of the Drones

Message.Msg: CARACAS - Opposition leaders derided another currency devaluation by President Hugo Chavez's government as evidence of economic incompetence, while some anxious Venezuelans hit the shops on Saturday in fear of price increases. Although Chavez has not been seen in public since cancer surgery two months ago in Cuba, ministers said he personally ordered the fifth devaluation of the bolivar in a decade of socialist economics - this time by 32 percent. Seen as an imperative by economists but widely unpopular among Venezuelans, the measure is the biggest test yet for Vice President Nicolas Maduro, who has been in charge of the government since Chavez's December 11 operation. "The Maduro-Cabello duo are finishing off our Venezuela, we must not allow it!" said opposition leader Henrique Capriles. "They spent the money on (election) campaigning, corruption and gifts abroad. What a lying government!" he tweeted. That's what they do in America. But Obama's weak dollar policy takes it down slowly so lemmings don't realize they are beng robbed.
